description:
In Grad Wars all players are students in different Universities. Their aim is to get their degree before everyone else does by passing 20 lessons first. They do this either by studying hard, or by visiting the other players in their classroom and harassing them.

Players can pass up to 5 lessons in every turn. They get their grade by rolling a 10-sided die for every lesson and then modifying the die with cards thrown by themselves or other players.

Cards can be adding or subtracting from a grade, and they can be special cards. But basically they describe student life as it is, or rather as we think it is. Players drink tons of coffee, they get shut in in bunkers to study focused, and they give exams using a Divine Pen. They also invade other players’ homes to sabotage their alarm clock, and they cause a Zombie Apocalypse inside other players’ classrooms. And they start crying in front of professors to get a passing grade, they cheat like there is no tomorrow, and they go to parties that cause year-long hangovers. Grad Wars is a game for the students who want to get their degree first no matter what the cost, or the means.

ΑυτÏŒ γÎ¯νεται εÎ¯τε με το να κÎ¬τσει να διαβÎ¬σει, Î® με το να πηγαÎ¯νει στη σχολÎ® του Î¬λλου και να τον παρενοχλεÎ¯. Σε κÎ¬θε γÏρο μπορεÎ¯ να δÏŽσει μÎ­χρι 5 μαθÎ®ματα, και οι γÏροι συνεχÎ¯ζονται μÎ­χρι να βγει κÎ¬ποιος νικητÎ®ς.

Οι κÎ¬ρτες περιγρÎ¬φουν τη φοιτητικÎ® ζωÎ® Î­τσι ÏŒπως εÎ¯ναι, Î® μÎ¬λλον Î­τσι ÏŒπως πιστεÏουμε ÏŒτι εÎ¯ναι. Ο παÎ¯χτης πÎ¯νει τÏŒνους καφÎ­, κλεÎ¯νεται σε πυρηνικÎ¬ καταφÏγια για να διαβÎ¬σει πιο συγκεντρωμÎ­νος, γρÎ¬φει εξετÎ¬σεις με το ΣτυλÏŒ των ΘεÏŽν. ΜπαÎ¯νει στο σπÎ¯τι του Î¬λλου και του σαμποτÎ¬ρει το ξυπνητÎ®ρι, κλεÎ¯νει γρÎ¯πη σε Î­να βαζÎ¬κι και το βÎ¬ζει κÎ¬τω απÏŒ μÏτες, στÎ­λνει ΖÏŒμπι ΣυμφοιτητÎ­ς στο αμφιθÎ­ατρο των συμπαικτÏŽν του. Ο ΠτυχιοÏχος εÎ¯ναι το παιχνÎ¯δι του ΦυτοÏ, του φοιτητÎ® που πρÎ­πει να πÎ¬ρει πτυχÎ¯ο πρÏŽτος με καθε μÎ­σο.

From the publisher's website:

Welcome to Top Billing! In this game, you and your friends become competing movie producers working on a film. Your objective is to duke it out with the others to put your unique imprint on the final film by gathering Actors, Sets, and Props. By strategically putting them together to earn you the most points, you can earn the title of executive producer and Top Billing!

Game of observation and reaction for young children. One player throws a pair of six-sided dice to establish the target color combination. Players then search amongst a pile of butterfly figures for the butterfly with the matching color combination. The player who finds (i.e., "catches") the correct butterfly receives a scoring counter. The first player to get five counters wins the game.

~ Introduction ~
Ever wondered if you could survive the Apocalypse? Test out your survival strategies in the most realistic Post-Apocalyptic card game ever created, Survivalistic! Set in a modern day Post-Apocalyptic era, Survivalistic lets a player embark on an epic journey with fellow survivors. While on this journey, survivors will unite with one another to form clans. A player's clan must outlast and outwit all opposing clan members in order to win. Survivalistic is sure to thrill any gamer on any level. Please feel free to check out the brand new card game Survivalistic!

~ Family Friendly ~
Don't be mistaken by the theme, this game makes for a great family game! No violence, no explicit images, and no brutality. This game focuses on survival strategy by using moral methods instead. These methods include: farming, cultivating, pillaging, adapting to new environments, purifying water, communication skills, gathering resources, resource management, hunting, and scavenging. The youngsters will find the game very easy to learn and enjoy playing time and time again!

~ Player Interaction ~
The player interaction in Survivalistic makes it a great social game. Just the fact that you have so many opportunities to get back at your opponent makes it incredibly fun. Players may find themselves losing at one point and then winning the next! Because you are often stealing and battling other players for resources there is hardly a dull moment.

~ Game Play ~
The deck symbolizes the various paths in which one can take through the apocalyptic world. While on this path your prime objective will be to build a team of survivors. This team of survivors will be called your clan. You can find water, food, equipment, and fellow survivors along the way to enhance your clan. Your clan members will display many skills while on your journey and these events are represented through clan member abilities. There are many strategies to this game through all the different types of cards and there are countless number of ways you can arrange your clan. In order for your clan to reign supreme they must be nourished with food and water. Nourished clan members may battle opposing clans for valuable resources. In the end, the first clan to have three clan members fully nourished at the same time wins the game. These elements make up the basis of the game. You can use any combination of cards but one thing must happen, you must survive!

A word dice game with 12 letter dice.

Players roll the dice and make words of three or more letters. Blank sides are wild.

Scoring:


     1 point for each letter used
     35 bonus points for spelling Throw or Word


If a player uses all 12 dice, he gets a free roll.

The winner is the first person to reach 200 points.

A word dice game for 2 to 4 players. Players take turns to roll the dice and race against an hourglass to spell words for points. Similar to Challenge, it is also played on a board with double and triple spaces. Unlike Challenge, it is limited to four players.

Flynn, the pirate owl is a real mischief-maker. Very secretly he has pinched anything and everything that he could fi nd on deck and has stashed it away in the look-out – the crow‘s nest: the gold drinking cups of the crew, the captain‘s sword, the treasure chest, the jewellery for the lady pirates and a few mice – just in case. You can never know how long you‘re going to be left sitting high and dry. Cheekily, he‘s throned high up in the crow‘s nest and is smirking joyfully over so many riches. It‘s no surprise that the ship‘s crew is fuming and want their belongings back!

Find the objects that Flynn has stashed away in the crow‘s nest. A die shows you what you have to look for. Like in the trick with the table cloth you have to pull a cord stick to a card and hope that the Flynn stays in his nest and that the nest is not toppling over.

Battle of Byeokjegwan is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #1.

The Battle of Byeokjegwan is a battle between Japan and China, fought in Korean peninsula on 27 January 1593.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Byeokjegwan

Including one mapsheet, six Chinese units, nine Japanese units, two markers and two dice. Each unit represents one commander and his troop. Rules, tutorial and historical notes are included in "Battle on the Table".

Chinese victory condition is decline of Japanese morale or killing Kobayakawa Takakage or Ukita Hideie. Japanese victory condition is rise of Japanese morale or killing Li Rusong.

Once more, conflict rages across the world of Aerim. You are one of the Eternals, a group of immortals forever waging war from the shadows. Call forth your champions to battle against those of your timeless foes. Harness the legacy of each champion's deeds as they echo across time to empower the next. For the Champions of Aerim, this cycle continues, as it always has and always will. For the Eternals, there is only...strife.

Strife, a two-player strategy card game that plays in around an hour, is a game where you always know your opponent's options. Aside from mastering the unique combo-creating gameplay of your champions, figuring out how to outmaneuver your opponent is where the true challenge lies.

Each player has the same hand of ten champions and will simultaneously play them as they fight over key locations throughout Aerim worth varying victory points. Each champion has a battle ability that's triggered during battles and a legacy ability that can be used only while on top of the legacy pile. This creates an intricate latticework of strategy for the players as each champion must be considered for not only what he can do in the current battle, but for which ability he will add to the next.

Further impacting the critical decisions within the game is the Fatestone tie-breaking system. The Fatestone starts at a value of one, and whoever holds the Fatestone die loses all ties; that player may instead pass the stone to his opponent to claim a victory in that tie, but doing so raises the value of the Fatestone by one each time it is passed. At the end of the game, the player holding the Fatestone adds its final value to his victory point tally. Whichever player has the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

You're a mad scientist with the goal of evolving cute animals into minions in order to destroy the enemy's animals. Each creature can evolve into three different evolution trees, each with their own unique skills.

Evilution is a stand-alone card game. Each player chooses four animals to start the game with and performs actions each turn to further their position. Once you kill all the opposing creatures, you win the game.

In order to evolve your animals, you'll need to purchase evolution trees. You can earn money through sponsorships as well as completing objectives. You can also use the money to hire lab assistants and purchase equipment.

Also, every turn you'll either navigate random events or discover potions with good and bad effects. Some of your creatures may die, but that's a sacrifice you must be willing to make.

Do you have what it takes to be the best Mad Scientist? Only time will tell.

Letter Dice is a word dice game similar to Spill and Spell and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, where players make words to score points.

It scores differently than those games, with objectives like longest word and most words:

Throw the dice and race against your opponents (and the clock) to turn the jumbled-up letters into words. Can you make the longest word? Can you make the greatest number of words? Can you score the most points? Lots of different rapid-fire challenges for word game fans of all ages.

It is for 2 or more players.

Texarkana Trivia is a knock-off of Trivial Pursuit, focused on local trivia about the Texas-Arkansas-Louisiana (Tex-Ark-Ana) tri-state area.  Two to four players roll-and-move around a board decorated with local businesses, answer questions about local history and miscellanea, and collect four colored pegs for their pawn.  The first player to bring a pawn with all four pegs to the center wins!

Mariáš (the final sound is pronounced as "sh") is the most popular card game in the Czech Republic and Slovakia, often seen being played in pubs. This trick-taking game is the basis for Ulti, the national card game of Hungary.

It is played with a 32-card deck, similar to the William Tell deck but with specific Bohemian art. There are four suits: hearts, bells, acorns, and leaves, each with eight cards: ace, king, over-knave, under-knave, 10, 9, 8, and 7.

The most common setup is with three players, with one player playing alone against a partnership of the other two for each hand. The lone player seeks to win more card points than the other two players together. Points are received for winning aces and tens in tricks, winning the last trick, and for the combination of king and over-knave of a suit. There are also several bonuses and penalties that affect the final score.

(Description borrowed from Mariáš page on pagat.com)

Two players confront one another to construct the least high tower with 3D polyominoes.

Both players have a gameboard 3x3. In the center of the table, there are 29 3D polyominoes. Initially, each player chooses a polyomino. When both players have chosen a polyomino, they exchange. Everyone must now place the piece on his board. A polyomino must not exceed the gameboard. Then everyone chooses a new polyomino.

When each player has placed 14 polyominoes, the game is over. The player whose tower is less high wins.

Die verrückte Reise durch Nordrhein-Westfalen has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Nordrhein-Westfalen, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon  at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

Die verrückte Reise durch Baden-Württemberg has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Baden-Württemberg, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon  at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

Welcome to Arle
In Fields of Arle, created by Uwe Rosenberg, one to two players live as farmers in the small and peaceful town of Arle in East Frisia. The flax grown in the land surrounding the village makes it a profitable place to work and live. Fields of Arle takes players through four and a half years of this era of prosperity, with different opportunities available as the seasons change. Farm the land to capitalize on the demand for flax, or find other ways to make the most of the small town’s prosperity.

Work the Land
Whether you delve into flax farming or leverage other areas of expertise, always make sure that you have the land to build up your village. Construct dikes to keep the waters at bay and expand your fields. Dry out bogs to harvest peat and then clear the land for cultivation. Create more fields for your livestock, buildings, or future crops; after that, you can decide whether to house animals or cultivate a forest for timber. Perhaps you’d like to take up some flax farming for yourself, or diversify and try out a little bit of everything.

Tools of the Trade
At the outset of each half year, you’ll choose how you’d like to spend that time working. There are many ways to build your fortune. Use the Master space to increase the tools at your disposal, focus on the Cattle Trainer to make the most of your livestock, or build up your fleet of vehicles and ship out goods. Taking stock of your progress differs depending on the season. You may milk your existing livestock or care for a bunch of newborn animals. You could harvest your flax in the fall, and shear your sheep in spring. At the end of each half year, you’ll need to take stock of your progress by unloading your vehicles and feeding your family and animals, so keep an eye on the season and do your best to keep the farm growing and everyone well fed!

Travel and Prosper
Once you’ve made headway in clearing fields and stocking up goods, it's time to make your products available to potential buyers. The more vehicles you have, the more goods you can ship. Send things into the wide world to increase your Travel Experience and grant you points over the course of the four and a half years of the game. Build up your farm and your vehicles and get your goods out into the world to make the most of every season. There are many roads to success in Fields of Arle, so pick your path, work the land, and enjoy the friendly competition as you strive to make your fortune!

- from the publisher's website

A microgame of tricks and treasure.

The goal is to find the map leading to buried treasure.  And someone on this pirate ship has the map!  To win, find that map and hold on to it, surviving the round - or be the last pirate alive with the lowest ranking card.

Rules:

• Each player is dealt two cards.

• Players can choose to use one or two cards against their opponents, discard and draw a new card, or bluff.

• A player can bluff as long as they have at least one card of the card type needed to perform an action in their 
hand.

Example: Danielle has one “Barrel o’ Grog” card and one “Cannon” card in her hand. She decides that she wants to use the 
special ability that requires two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. This special requires that every player with a “Barrel o’ Grog” 
card must place the grog card face up in front of them.  That card is out of play for the rest of the game.  Those players now may only have one card in their hand.

• If a player does not believe that another player has the cards to do the action they just performed, they may call 
the player’s bluff.  If the first player was lying, they have to reveal the card that was the lie, and they discard their remaining card and draw a new one.

Example: John doesn’t believe Danielle has two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. He calls her bluff. As Danielle did not have 
two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards, she places the “Cannon” card in front of her, as it was the lie - and that card is now 
out of play. She then discards her “Barrel o’ Grog” and draws a new card.  She is now down to having only one card in her hand.

• When the deck runs out of cards, the discard pile may be shuffled back in to form the draw pile.

• When there are no more cards to be drawn and no discard pile, the players that are still alive reveal their hands and what is stored in their “Smuggler's Chambers”.  The player with the lowest numbered card wins.

Drop Box location for PnP rules are located here.
Drop Box location for high-quality PnP card art is located here.

This game won first place for the 24 hour contest - March 2014.

Deal: American Dream is a board game for 3 to 6 players. Each player masters a clan and competes for the dominion of drug trafficking in the Americas.

Deal: American Dream is a strategic game where players recruit troops and clash over territories. Additionally, it incorporates an economic dimension; you can produce or buy dope, and sell it by striking deals with other players rather than confronting them. As every narco knows, spilling blood ain’t always good for business.

Finally, Deal: American Dream also has a roleplaying aspect to it; each player has secret objectives that require the use of deception and bluff. Regardless of which avenue to power you take, in the end, there can only be one winner: the first one to earn 10 respect points takes the cake. Every game of Deal: American Dream is unique and brings its share of negotiation, alliance and, of course, backstabbing!

All the components needed for a game of Deal Corner can be found in the Deal: American Dream's box. It was available separately in the Kickstarter.

Comanchería is the second game in Joel Toppen's "First Nations" series. Like its predecessor, Navajo Wars, Comanchería is a solitaire game in which the player plays from the Native American tribe's point of view.

In Comanchería, the player takes command of the Comanche nation. The player must drive hostile tribes from the southern plains, establish dominance over the region, set up trade networks with both friendly tribes and colonial powers, and finally defend all of this against relentless military and cultural attack.

While many mechanics will feel similar to Navajo Wars, Comanchería is a very different game. Comanchería promises to deliver all the tough decisions and drama that Navajo Wars players have come to expect, but with a faster playing time and more streamlined victory objectives.

Objective: be the first reaching space 101 (up and down the Eiffel Tower)
 - moving by turns -
Roll the die and move forward; ending on a red marked space follow instructíons.

Note:
Game was published first in 1889 (inauguration); moderate changes (see images) within a reprint; mentioned artist: L. Robert

Space Frontier is a game of space exploration for 2-4 players. Players compete to spread their influence across a region of uncharted space.  The game takes roughly an hour to an hour and a half to play with 2 players with each additional player adding about a half hour.

Each player controls a command ship and its supporting fleets. The command ship is a mobile factory, research lab, and ship carrier. Players will use it to construct the fleets that help spread their influence far and wide.

The modular space map is built from randomized tiles each game as players explore. The random map generation ensures no two games of Space Frontier are exactly the same.

Players gain influence through missions, research, trade, or conquest. Players can be as cooperative or antagonistic with each other as they wish. Thus, games can be played and won where military might reigns supreme, or without a shot being fired.

Objective: ballance your income/your expenses; learn mechanism of insolvency
 - acting by turns -
roll the die: each player moves forward according number on a circle; ending on a marked space draw appropiate card and follow instructions. Players are at the mercy of luck - but can protect themselves by spending their money carefully, underwriting riscs, ... Game ends after agreed time or completed circles.

note:
produced by F.X. Schmid; playing time strongly dependend on no. of participants; suitable for school classes.

Objective: give most correct answers within a given time; learn more about the (greater) Braunschweig region
 - acting by turns -

Choose a starting place; move on a grid according die roll; draw appropriate card - city or 'Hoppla' - and give correct answer/follow instructions.

Objective: collect as many animals cards (pairs) as possible, bringing them back home & gaining bonus chips.
 - acting by turns -

Roll the die and move forward on a circle; flip appropiate animal card; finding a matching pair you may bring them gome gaining a bonus chip; a dragon will let you fly, a rat will turn over all already flipped cards.

Game ends after all animals are brought home.

Rycerze i Zamki (which means "Castles and Knights") is a part of Egmont Polska game series: "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie".

In the game the players fight to conquer castles using their knights. Each player is given the same set of knight cards. Each knight has three powers. The powers to conquer stone, brick and wooden castles.

On each turn one castle from the castle pile is revealed and then each player selects two cards from their hands and reveal them simultaneously. The player who's combined power of particular value (depending on the castle type) of their knights is the highest takes the castle and the next turn proceeds. The player who grabs the castles with the most points on them is the winner.

O que seria da vida sem alguém ao nosso lado? Amizades que podem virar paixão e por que não amor?
 Em marry me?! Os jogadores são pessoas em busca de sua cara metade, com gostos variados, que ao longo dos anos passaram por vários relacionamentos, terão recaídas com os “ex”, para que no final possam dizer em alto e bom som “–Marry me?” (-casa comigo?) ou não 
(a vida não é perfeita).
Do que você gosta? 
 Pessoas mais velhas? Pessoas jovens? Loiras(o)? Morenas(o)? , independente do seu gosto pessoal, no fim o que vai realmente importar é ser feliz.

English translation:
What would life be without someone on our side? Friendships that can turn to passion and, why not, love?

In marry me?! Players are people searching for their soul mate, with varying tastes. Over the years, they may have gone through several relationships, and may relapse with an "ex", so in the end they can say loud and clear "Marry me?" (House me?) or not 
(Life is not perfect).

What do you like?

Regardless of your personal taste in the end what will really matter in this game is to be happy.

The music edition of Konito?. Complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card.

The object is to be the first to complete famous song titles and lyrics, or try to make your teammates find the right answer by any possible means.

Bitwy XXI Wieku (Battles of XXIth Century) is a wargame system taking place in the first decades of XXIth century. The game contains maps for central Europe, Ukraine and Iraq. The units belong to the Polish, Russian, American, Iraqi, German, Ukrainian and British armies.

The counters use NATO symbols, while each units has points table for different equipment for different conflicts - for example, the three tables for polish armored units are for T-72, PT-91 and Leopard tanks.

Each hex represents one kilometer and each counter a company. The game will be also available with wooden tiles instead of counters. There are three scenarios:
- Russian attack in Bartoszyce area, Poland, in 2014
- Ukrainian-Russian fights in Crimea in 2014
- British attack on Basra during second Iraq war in 2003

Following scenarios were published in the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine:
- BiaÅ‚y Konwój (2/2014)
- "Japkowa" Wojna (2/2014)
- Operacja "StraÅ¼ na Eufracie" (2/2014)
- Krymskie dzieci (1/2015)

Truth is a strategic Pattern making game of Divine proportions; featuring 270 graphic Scripture cards, with a Bible verse on each card!

Become Champion of Truth by receiving Blessings, Rewards, and Victory Points, from creating various types of Patterns.

Draw and Play cards each turn. Thwart your peers from making patterns, while building your own. Making certain patterns give various special bonuses to your efforts.

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. Collect 10 Victory Points
2. Achieve the Creation Pattern (6 Scriptures)
3. Achieve the Atonement Pattern (10 Spirits)

The first to meet one of the above Victory Conditions is proclaimed Champion of Truth!

Immunity is a board game in which your immune system will fight against the pathogens agents that attempt to infect your body. Become the healthiest player of the table, and live all your life free of harmful diseases! Take the control of virus, bacteria and parasites, and strike the vital organs of your rivals! The game emulates in a proper way some aspects of the immunity, like the inflammation, adverse effects of medicaments, the disease transmission, the spread of tumors, and many others.

In this card game, each player receives an organism board which shows the health of your five vital systems (nervous, cardiorespiratory, digestive, hepatic, and renal), as well as your age throughout the life.  There are also two environment squares that will be occupied with the pathogens before they invade your organism. In addition, the board shows different human cells (red blood cells, immune cells, platelet, etc) that can be bought with oxygen. These cells are responsible for eliminating pathogens.

There are 3 types of deck cards in the game. Pathogen cards can be placed on the environment squares of the rivals, in order to infect and harm their organs. Medic cards can be used to prevent damage, transplant organs, eradicate microorganisms, etc. There is a common deck for all the players, the environmental deck, which represents hazardous effects that can affect the health of a person, like occupational accidents, blood donation and school fights.

Here comes the CAT FASHION SHOW! Dress your cats up and have them show off your fascinating costume design on the catwalk stage! Whoever earns the greatest fame after three fashion show seasons will be crowned the Master of Catwalk. But be alert! Don't let those copycats get all the fame out of cloning your masterpiece!

In Copy Catwalk, players earn fame points by carefully playing their cat cards (number 0-10 plus three Copycat). Cat cards with higher number (more gorgeous costumes) win you some bonus, but only if no one play the same number as yours. Playing Copycat cards grants you no fame points, but they give you chances to copy other players scored costumes in the end of every season.

Manage your cat cards carefully, predict your competitors' next move wisely, wish for the best luck using your Copycat, and you shall become the Master of Copy Catwalk!

A stand-alone game that integrates with Rock Science or Rock Science: Festival.

320 new questions to Rock Science. Of Bandit Rock (Swedish Radio Station). In Swedish. Boost your original game or play instantly with the included special rules.

Challenge your mates and see who is the most rock for real! Three difficulty levels and smart betting allows the beginner to  give the uber nerd a fair fight. Perfect for pre-party or a hard-packed evening.

Meet the heaviest rock stars, remember the songs and hear the wildest stories.


     320 new questions about the myths, rock stars, songs and albums. 
     Play directly with the supplied Booster Pack Rules. 
     Bandits host reveals juicy details about rock stars ... and themselves!

Rive is a multi-faction strategic game where the contents of your customizable deck (units, actions & battlefield manipulation cards) interact with a hex-based game board.

Designed for 2-4 players, and taking about an hour to play, Rive blends together familiar game mechanics to create a combat focused, highly replayable, deeply strategic and unique gameplay experience.

Attempt to destroy your opponent’s fortress before they destroy yours by playing a variety of different units, actions and battlefield manipulation cards from your hand. Each unit comes with a corresponding hex tile that is placed strategically on the battlefield. Utilize special powers unique to your faction and to your units to give you an edge on the battlefield all while taking advantage of dynamic game board features to block or trap other units.

Cards

There are twelve icons, each with a different point value. Each six-sided card has either two different sets of three identical icons (ie: 3 Fire icons and 3 Beaker icons), or has one set of identical icons (ie: 6 Beaker icons), known as a hextuple. (Hextuple? We made up this word. Think of a "double" in dominoes.) The value of each card is the sum of the values of each icon and is displayed in the center of each card.

Hextuples

A hextuple is a card where all the icons are the same. There is a hextuple for every icon. Every round of the game is started by placing a hextuple in the center of the playing surface. You can play just one round, or you can play multiple rounds, starting with a different hextuple each time. Choose it before distributing cards to the players.

If you play a hextuple during your turn, you can play another card during your turn to match it.

Scoring

During your turn, you play one card from your inventory by matching icons with one or more cards already played. Your score is the value of your card plus the value of the cards you matched.

Replenish

You must always have ten cards in your inventory. You can keep your inventory in your hand or just place them in front of you on the playing surface. After you play a card, you replenish your inventory by drawing a card from the pile. If you play a hextuple and are able to match it with another card from your inventory, you draw two cards.

Jokers

Jokers are wild. They can match any icon and each of the three Joker hextuples can be used to match six cards at once. They have no point value when played, but make sure you play them, because their value switches to 100 points and count against your score if left in your inventory.

Ending Rounds

Keep playing until all the cards in the pile are drawn. Then play until someone has played all their cards or until no other play can be made. Each player then adds up the card values left in their inventory and subtracts the sum from their score.

Ending Play

If you play multiple rounds, you can add the scores from each round to determine the winner. Or, you can treat each round separately and award a point to the player with the highest score for each round, and the winner is the player who won the most rounds.

Speakeasy is a 75-minute, hidden role/social deduction game for 10-40 people, similar to games like Werewolf, The Resistance, or Two Rooms and a Boom. It is simple to learn, but has lots of room for strategy and rewards repeat playing. Speakeasy can be played at home, in a pub, or anywhere the group can fit. It is not turn-based and is played as you move around and mingle (or avoid) other players - the game happens continuously at the speed of your strategy.

ItÊ¼s the Roaring Twenties, and corruption is on the rise in your city. The Mob rules the streets, and its reach extends even further—to the police force, the courts, and even City Hall. The MobÊ¼s crews of thieves, hitmen, bootleggers, dirty lawyers, speakeasy owners, con artists and cops on the take think they hold the real reins of power in this city.

The long arm of the law has grown shorter of late, but citizens have reason to hope. An organization of crime fighters unafraid to take a stand has emerged as a force strong enough to oppose the Mob. This crew of untouchables, vigilantes, undercover cops, honest politicians, and special agents are rallying under the new Federal Marshal in town, proving the city the forces of good might be down, but they arenÊ¼t out!

Now itÊ¼s time for you to choose a side and play your part in deciding the fate of the city—for better or worse.

Speakeasy is a game of creative deception, hidden identities, and strategy. To start, one player volunteers as Moderator and gives everyone a secret role on one of two teams: the Mob or the Feds. The fog of war is thick in the beginning, as playersÊ¼ first task is to use their secret passwords to identify who to trust. As the game goes on, players learn how to hustle as they continue to identify and organize their teammates, discover the other teamÊ¼s secrets, sow misinformation, infiltrate the opposition, and score points—all while watching their own backs. Play ends after one hour, and the winning team is the one that accrues the most points.

"Smart Guy in the pocket" in English is simple category card game.
There is letter in one side of the card and theme (mammals, cities, occupations, games etc.) in another side of the card. Turn around top card and be the first to say something that matches the theme from one card starting the letter from another card and You get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

Other variants included.

(from the coverback)
English (google translation)
Live a thrilling final as never Newteam SC between  and FC Muppet!
Now you can enjoy the strength of football in this board game as simple as exciting.
Deploy your strategy, use your cards and you will get amazing goals.
When all your dreams are at stake and all your team depends on you, your passion for the game will take you to victory.
Who will win? Does the tactical skill of Oliver Atom or aggression of Mark Lenders?
Fight to the last breath!
(Based in Captain Tsubasa cartoons)



No official:This game is a faithful simulation of a soccer match cartoon of the Captain Tsubasa serie.

The objective of the game is that when you finish the game, your team has scored more goals than the opposite.
Before the game start there is the choosing to play 45 minutes or 90.

The game simulates a soccer match through a square board by both player's chips from each team as the ball moves. In turn, the player controls the team through a deck of team cards where describe the skills of each player and 3 cards of injuries on opposing players (21 total cards each player).

Player's chips can injure and even have warnings by yellow and red cards.

An interesting engine ball movement from a 6-sided die on the inside of the lid of the box with directions drawn on a grid 3x3 solves the movement of the ball where a tie in points between the  player's chips.


De la contraportada:

Spanish 
!Vive como nunca la apasionante final entre el Newteam S.C y el Muppet F.C!
Ahora puedes disfrutar de la intensidad del fútbol en este juego de mesa tan sencillo como trepidante
Despliega tu estrategia, utiliza bien tus cartas y marcarás goles increíbles.
Cuando todos tus sueños están en juego y todo tu equipo depende de ti, tu pasión por el fútbol te llevará hacia la victoria.
¿Quién ganará? ¿la habilidad táctica de Oliver Atom o la agresividad de Mark Lenders?
!Lucha hasta el último aliento!
(basado en la serie de dibujos Oliver y Benji)

---
No oficial:

Este juego es una fiel simulación de un partido de fútbol de serie de dibujos animados de Campeones.

El objetivo del juego es que cuando acabe el partido, tu equipo haya marcado más goles que el contrario.
Previamente al juego hay que escoger jugar a 45 minutos o a 90.

El juego simula un partido de fútbol, mediante un tablero cuadriculado por el que se mueven tanto las fichas de jugadores de cada equipo como el balón. A su vez, el jugador que controla el equipo juega con un mazo de cartas de equipo donde se describen las habilidades de cada jugador así como 3 cartas de lesiones sobre jugadores del equipo contrario (21 cartas en total cada jugador).

Los jugadores se pueden lesionar e incluso ser amonestados por tarjetas amarillas y rojas.

Un interesante motor de movimiento del balón a partir de un dado de 6 caras sobre la cara interior de la tapa de la caja con direcciones dibujadas en una cuadrícula 3x3 resuelve el movimiento de el esférico en los casos que haya empate de puntos entre las fichas de jugadores.

Objective: Be the first reaching the top of a palm tree with all 3 of your apes
 - moving by turns -

A palm tree is built up (trunk acts as a board).

Each player tries to climb up to the top (palm branches) with his 3 apes by rolling 2 dice. Obtaining a double a chimpanzee is moved instead - kicking down all apes he's passing on the trunk (up or down).

Note: translation of the title 'I'm deloused by an ape' with the meaning: getting surprised

Expanded by:

     Hat-Trick: 'Players' Expansion (2016)


Hat-Trick is a highly-tactical football card game for two players (managers) that simulates a complete football (soccer) match.

Managers use player-cards to make a football pitch and move their players, while two identical sets of action cards let them perform various actions: short passes, long balls or dribblings. Putting the ball in the final line of the pitch triggers a Scoring Opportunity phase, which is a mini-game in itself and is performed using shooting and goalkeeping cards.

The game contains 32 ready-to-play national teams of variable strength. Moreover, it is possible to customize your own teams based on any club in the world.

Objective: be the first turning back home (space 110); learn more about the world.
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on marked space follow instructions glued into lid;

Notes:
Should had been published ~1900s;
Activities like visiting an opium den in China convey a feeling about the spirit of that time

Taggle d'amour is an expansion to Taggle that may be played standalone.

Taggle d'amour adds 35 'Thoughts' and 20 'Retort' Love-themed cards to the classic Taggle game.

As in Taggle, each player draws a 'Retort' card. Each turn, a new player reads out loud one of the 'Thoughts' lines and the other players, one after another, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funniest retort. The player who read the "Thoughts" card then gives a "Taggle" counter to the player who provided the lamest retort.

Once a player has accumulated 5 "Taggle" counters, he is declared loser.

Objective: Learn numbers between 1 and 24
 - acting by turns -

Flip 24 tiles upside down (symbols or numbers) - other corresponding 24 matching tiles stay visible.

Randomly draw one one of the flipped tiles and find within a given time the matching one; the 'puzzle' concept let you prove if right or wrong.

Game ends after all tiles are merged. Player with most matching pairs is the winner.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.

My Happy Farm is a game in which players strive to become the best farmer.

All players have their own farm with four nice animals. They feed those cuties. Animals which are fed well fill their stomachs with tasty food, grow and become longer and longer, even reaching unnatural lengths. The longer your animal, the better a farmer you are. The owner of the longest animal receives bonus points. Animals which aren't fed even one time lose their weight, take offense, and leave their bad master. Moreover, they will take some victory points from the bad master to punish him, so players have to be good and careful farmers and feed their animals well to create Their Own Happy Farm.

This is a new edition with new art and the box is already contains the expansion Gazda.

You are a pioneer.  You must build your settlement up into an epic Kingdom.  Choose your land and structures carefully to optimize how many resources you produce.

On a player's turn you choose an action: Develop, Produce, Build, and Consume, and perform that action on your turn.  Victory Points are gained at the end of the game for your size of your settlement, the buildings, and the resources you produce.  The game ends when either the tile stack runs out OR there are no more VP tokens OR someone has filled all the spaces on their board.  The player with the most Victory Points is the winner!
